page.title: 10RELIGION IN GLASSARY
page.content: THERE IS ONLY ONE CHURCH IN GLASSARY AND THAT IS THE CHURCH OF SCOTLAND. MOST PEOPLE OF THE VILLAGE ARE NOMINALLY PROTESTANT BUT THERE ARE ONLY TWO FAMILIES WHO BELONG TO THE ROMAN CATHOLIC RELIGION. VERY FEW OF THE VILLAGERS ATTEND THE LOCAL CHURCH NOR DO MANY OF THE CHILDREN ATTEND SUNDAY SCHOOL. THIS IS PROBABLY A REFLECTION OF THE GENERAL ATTITUDE TOWARDS RELIGION IN MOST OF PRESENT DAY SCOTLAND. THE CHURCH HOWEVER IS USED BY MOST OF THE POPULATION AT SOME TIME IN THEIR LIFE, ESPECIALLY FOR BAPTISMS, MARRIAGES AND DEATHS. ON THE OCCASION OF THE LATTER THE CHURCH CAN OFTEN BE FULL TO CAPACITY. AT EASTER, REMEMBRANCE DAY, CHRISTMAS AND SPECIAL SERVICES THERE CAN OFTEN BE A FAIR SIZED CONGREGATION.
